description.en: Appanna, son of Umeśabhaṭṭa, on the banks of river Bhīmā, engrossed in Śrīvidyā became preceptor after initiation and remained in KāmakoṭiPīṭha adorning the Śāradāpīṭhikā for thirty-five years. The noble Gaṅgādhara attained siddhi on the pratipad (first day) of bright fortnight in the month Śravaṇa of the year Saumya.
